greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Winner of n-th Littlewood Frog Race.
comment: For 0 < k <= n, gcd(n,k) = 1, let P(n,k) be the smallest prime of the form a*n+k, with a >= 0. "Frog" k0 is said to win "race" n if P(n,k0) is largest of the phi(n) values P(n,k).
In case of draws of P(n,k) values take the largest k. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 26 2015
maple: for k from 1 to n do
mathematica: A038025P[n_, k_] := Module[{a}, For[a = 0, True, a++, If[PrimeQ[a n + k], Return[a]]]];
A038025[n_] := Module[{a = 0, phiMax = 0, phi, k}, For[k = 1, k <= n, k++, If [GCD[k, n] == 1, phi = A038025P[n, k]; If[phi >= phiMax, a = k; phiMax = phi]]]; a];
Array[A038025, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 16 2020, after _R. J. Mathar_ *)
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_ from a problem by _David W. Wilson_
